item.title: Jury orders Tesla to pay more than $240 million in damages after fatal Autopilot crash
item.description: A Miami jury decided that Elon Musk’s car company Tesla was partly responsible for a deadly crash in Florida.

item.title: Resilient SRQ helps North Port resident build a new home
item.description: Joann Donahue’s house had to be demolished after being damaged by hurricanes Ian and Milton.

item.title: Ford recalls more than 300K trucks and SUVs due to brake defect
item.description: Ford said it is recalling more than 312,000 vehicles.

item.title: Suncoast seeing uptick in drowning incidents
item.description: The Manatee County Beach Patrol scans the beach for potential dangers.

item.title: Man, 82, develops bond with raccoon who visits his porch
item.description: A man has formed an unbelievable bond with a raccoon and its family.

item.title: Security guard quits over dispute about moving fan in wheelchair closer to Jelly Roll stage
item.description: A former security guard is speaking out after he quit on the spot during a Jelly Roll concert.

item.title: Nearly 40 volunteers gather to cleanup Tarpon Bay in Venice
item.description: Sarasota Bay Watch organized the cleanup to help remove as much debris as possible from Tarpon Basin.

item.title: Busy I-75 off-ramps to close again
item.description: More ramp closures on I-75 at US-301 may slow traffic.

item.title: Venice motorcyclist dies from injuries after crash on Englewood Road
item.description: The motorcycle hit the rear right side of a truck’s trailer, troopers said.

item.title: It is a battle between moisture and dust in the wind for the Suncoast
Ugandan pitcher chasing dreams on the Suncoast
item.description: "In Uganda, there are no fans. The people who come and watch are friends and other teammates."
